content: Singaporean electoral district (1955–1991) **Tanjong Pagar Single Member Constituency** was a [single member constituency](/wiki/Single-member_district) (SMC) in [Tanjong Pagar](/wiki/Tanjong_Pagar), Singapore. The constituency was formed in 1955 and was abolished in 1991. It was one of the longest-surviving constituencies since the pre-independence era, and has been a [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) stronghold. Throughout its history, the seat was only held by the late Prime Minister [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew), who held the longest political term in Parliament from 1955 to 2015. ## History In 1955, the Tanjong Pagar constituency was formed. It took over Sepoy Lines in 1976 and Anson in 1988. After [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) had passed the premiership to Goh Chok Tong in 1990, the constituency was even merged into [Tanjong Pagar GRC](/wiki/Tanjong_Pagar_GRC), and the legacy of the "Tanjong Pagar GRC" name continues to remain even after the death of Lee Kuan Yew in 2015. 1988 was also the last election of which Tanjong Pagar was contested during Lee Kuan Yew's time, following which during the final 24 years of Lee Kuan Yew in Tanjong Pagar GRC, the constituency was declared as walkover. ## Member of Parliament YearMember of ParliamentParty[Legislative Assembly of Singapore](/wiki/Legislative_Assembly_of_Singapore)**1955**[Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew)[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**1959****1963**[Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore)**1968**Lee Kuan Yew[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**1972****1976****1980****1984****1988** ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1950s [General Election
